page.title: 14WOODROFFE BOARDING AT LYME
page.content: There are three boarding houses at Woodroffe school. All the girls who board live at Rhode Hill, an old manor house. Rhode Hill is about 1.7 miles from the school. The girls walk to and from school. The boys in years 1 to 4 live at Harcombe House. They travel by coach to and from school. Harcombe used to be the girls residence until 1969. The senior boys, in years 5-7, live at St.Andrews, which is very close to the school. Each House Master is a teacher at the school and at least 8 staff from school either live at or work at the boarding houses as boarding house staff. There are 150-200 boarders at this state comprehensive school.
